author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Principal District and Sessions Court here on Monday convicted and sentenced a 21-year-old woman to undergo life imprisonment for killing her nine-month-old baby boy by throwing the infant into a farm well at Thazhuthazhai village near Arumbavur in May 2015.

Pronouncing the verdict, the Principal District and Sessions Judge A. Nazeema Banu slapped a fine of Rs. 1,000 on R. Vijayalakshmi.

According to prosecution, Vijayalakshmi who was married to Ramasamy of Poolampadi village had some misunderstanding with her husband. Ramasamy went abroad and Vijayalakshmi stayed in her grandmother’s house at Thazhuthazhai village.

The woman threw her nine-month-old male child into a well at Thazhuthazhai village killing the infant. On a complaint from her mother-in-law, S. Solaiyammal (56), the Arumbavur police arrested Vijayalakshmi and booked a case of murder against her.

The trial was held in the Principal District and Sessions Court and Vijayalakshmi was found guilty of committing the murder and sentenced to life imprisonment.
title: Woman gets life term for killing her child
